what: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: PremPredict package helps generate sensible predictions individual games entire season Premier League. can find automatically-updated Premier League predictor (uses codebase) landing page repo.

title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: can install development version PremPredict GitHub :

title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: use simplified version David Firth’s approach data Open Football repo GitHub predict outcome season’s Premier League. predictions based team’s strength, given performance recent times. define ‘recent’? order duck question, choose number different time periods. Please also see disclaimers notes automatically-updated Premier League predictor (linked ).

title: An R package to helps you to generate sensible predictions for individual games or an entire season of the Premier League
text: example analysis, using data collected towards end 2025/26 season. First, collect, combine tidy results data. Note want look back across season (far) predecessor. reference, can see prevailing table. can now model strengths sides home away. Next, use team strengths model future games across season. basis, can see looks like favourites win season. order project likelihood favourites becoming champions, though, need simulate many possible outcomes. Alternatively, table can generated, without calculating intermediate steps, running run_simulations.
code: library(PremPredict) data("example_thisSeason")  results_combined <- get_results(   results_thisSeason = example_thisSeason,    seasons = 1L   )  dim(results_combined) #> [1] 760   9 game_latest <- calc_game_latest(results = results_combined)  results_filtered <- get_results_filtered(   results = results_combined,    index_game_latest = game_latest,    lookback_rounds = 76L   )  dplyr::glimpse(results_filtered) #> Rows: 760 #> Columns: 8 #> $ matchday <date> 2024-08-16, 2024-08-17, 2024-08-17, 2024-08-17, 2024-08-17, … #> $ homeTeam <chr> "MUN", "IPS", "ARS", "EVE", "NEW", "NOT", "WHU", "BRE", "CHE"… #> $ awayTeam <chr> "FUL", "LIV", "WOL", "BRI", "SOU", "BOU", "AST", "CPA", "MCI"… #> $ FTHG     <dbl> 1, 0, 2, 0, 1, 1, 1, 2, 0, 1, 2, 0, 2, 4, 0, 4, 0, 1, 2, 2, 1… #> $ FTAG     <dbl> 0, 2, 0, 3, 0, 1, 2, 1, 2, 1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 1, 0, 2, 1, 6, 0, 1… #> $ FTR      <chr> "H", "A", "H", "A", "H", "D", "A", "H", "A", "D", "H", "A", "… #> $ played   <lgl> TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, T… #> $ match    <chr> "001", "002", "003", "004", "005", "006", "007", "008", "009"… data_table_current <- example_thisSeason |>    calc_table_current()  data_table_current |>    print_table_current() data_model <- results_filtered |>    model_prepare_frame() |>   model_run()  data_model #>  #> Call: #> gnm::gnm(formula = count ~ -1 + s + draw, eliminate = match,  #>     family = stats::quasipoisson, data = modelframe, start = rep(0,  #>         2 * nTeams + 1)) #>  #> Coefficients of interest: #> sARS_home  sAST_home  sBOU_home  sBRE_home  sBRI_home  sBUR_home  sCHE_home   #>    3.5887     3.3910     2.6672     2.7102     2.8616     3.0648     3.6256   #> sCPA_home  sEVE_home  sFUL_home  sLEE_home  sLIV_home  sMCI_home  sMUN_home   #>    2.1443     2.2261     2.2417     1.9925     4.2522     3.6907     2.2057   #> sNEW_home  sNOT_home  sSUN_home  sTOT_home  sWHU_home  sWOL_home  sARS_away   #>    3.3055     2.3953     4.3863     1.3325     1.0388     1.2459     3.5010   #> sAST_away  sBOU_away  sBRE_away  sBRI_away  sBUR_away  sCHE_away  sCPA_away   #>    2.2927     2.4675     2.0120     2.4678   -27.1656     2.5494     2.7080   #> sEVE_away  sFUL_away  sLEE_away  sLIV_away  sMCI_away  sMUN_away  sNEW_away   #>    1.9873     2.2584     1.1555     3.4702     2.7270     1.5472     2.3185   #> sNOT_away  sSUN_away  sTOT_away  sWHU_away  sWOL_away       draw   #>    2.7723     1.7477     1.9700     2.1102     1.5372     0.5316   #>  #> Deviance:            849.1585  #> Pearson chi-squared: 904.8874  #> Residual df:         879 data_parameters_unplayed <- data_model |>    model_extract_parameters()  data_model_parameters_unplayed <- model_parameters_unplayed(   results = results_filtered,   model_parameters = data_parameters_unplayed   )  data_points_expected_remaining <- data_model_parameters_unplayed |>     calc_points_expected_remaining()  calc_points_expected_total(   table_current = data_table_current,   points_expected = data_points_expected_remaining   ) |>    knitr::kable() number_simulations <- 100000  data_simulate_games <- simulate_games(   data_model_parameters_unplayed = data_model_parameters_unplayed,   value_number_sims = number_simulations,   value_seed = 2602L   )  data_simulate_standings <- simulate_standings(   data_game_simulations = data_simulate_games,   data_table_latest = data_table_current   )  simulate_outcomes(   data_standings_simulations = data_simulate_standings,   value_number_sims = number_simulations   ) |>    knitr::kable()

title: Assign the model parameters for unplayed games in this Premier League season. — run_simulations
text: results_thisSeason results generated running get_openData current season, 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/openfootball/football.json/refs/heads/master/2024-25/en.1.json'. data following columns names: number_match id values matches dataset character, typically "001" number_match_integer integer equivalent characters number_match matchday date match yyyy-mm-dd format homeTeam shortName home team, consistent data teams table awayTeam shortName away team, consistent data teams table FTHG integer number goals scored whole match home team FTAG integer number goals scored whole match away team FTR result match, factor three levels ... 'H', 'D' '' represent home win, draw away win, respectively played logical show game yet played year_end four figure integer value year season ends number_seasons integer required number previous seasons include. defaults zero. lookback_rounds integer number rounds fixtures use model (38L represent whole season). Defaults half season (, 19L). number_simulations integer number simulations use game remaining season. Defaults 25000L. value_seed integer seed use random numbers simulation. Defaults 120519L (, IMHO, great footballing day).

title: Assign the model parameters for unplayed games in this Premier League season. — run_simulations
